title: [Large-Scale] Hybrid Science Education Design Based on Learning Preferences of Gen Z and Alpha Generations

context.prior_knowledge: Comprehension of fundamental scientific theories and experimental methods
context.additional_context: Environment enabling real-time collaboration and multimedia content creation using personal devices (BYOD)

learning_goals: Learners form 3-member teams to write a science project proposal (3 days), establish experimental design and data collection plans (2 days), and collaboratively submit a final report (1 day) using digital tools (Zoom, Google Workspace) in a hybrid (online/offline) environment.
Learners strengthen data analysis competencies by solving real-world science problems using simulation software and virtual lab tools.

Learners produce a 3-minute video or A3 infographic explaining a science concept (e.g., photosynthesis, thermodynamics) incorporating ≥3 peer feedback iterations, achieving ≥80 points on the evaluation rubric (creativity 25%, scientific accuracy 35%, visual effectiveness 25%, practicality 15%).
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
